item.title: Need a Anti-Null
item.dc:creator: @jungledude jungledude
item.description:
@jungledude wrote:

[quote=“runescape3, post:3, topic:135770”]ill give a copy+ paste tut lol here:

Procedure
Step 1: look for your run() method in your client.java,
find this

		if(inStream.readUnsignedByte() != 14) {
			disconnected = true;
			return;
		}

Once you find that replace wit this:

		if(inStream.readUnsignedByte() != 14) {
			disconnected = true;
			PlayerHandler.players[playerId] = null;
			return;
		}[/quote]

Don’t leech from silab plz?

Read full topic

Its nice and simple, flat out. Im not a fag like you that flames a person because he said " Impressive ". Z0mg@ Call t3h cops joo, he said impressive. Grow up. STICK YOUR REPUTATION UP YOUR ASS.

It’s not the number that counts it’s how I got it. And I’m not flaming you for saying it’s impressive I’m simply asking why is that impressive if you’ve supposedly made a 460+ compatable server and client?

item.title: Need a Anti-Null
item.dc:creator: @Aff Aff
item.description:
@Aff wrote:

[quote=“ownage plz, post:6, topic:135770”][quote author=Exodust link=topic=187235.msg1691564#msg1691564 date=1187777306]

ill give a copy+ paste tut lol here:

Procedure
Step 1: look for your run() method in your client.java,
find this

		if(inStream.readUnsignedByte() != 14) {
			disconnected = true;
			return;
		}

Once you find that replace wit this:

		if(inStream.readUnsignedByte() != 14) {
			disconnected = true;
			PlayerHandler.players[playerId] = null;
			return;
		}

Impressive method, but mines has Anti-Null + Anti-SYI, his problem might be SYI.
[/quote]

How is …

if(inStream.readUnsignedByte() != 14) { disconnected = true; PlayerHandler.players[playerId] = null; return; }

Impressive ?[/quote]

It isn’t, but people may think it is, because the majority of people who have Anti-Null are people who leech off others, then edit something small, that isn’t needed.

Read full topic
